title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Southern California Hospitals (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Nurse recruiter reaches out and sets up a Zoom meeting with the nurse manager. The nurse manager asked General questions as well as scenario questions. Then explains the new grad program

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Southern California Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter was super nice and the interview was like an average interview. It had average interview questions (tell me about a time when…), but also questions about nursing situations (what would you do scenarios).
Interview Questions: Tell me about a hard interaction with a patient.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Southern California Hospitals in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: You get email or text from the recruiter scheduling for interview, you do Zoom interview and they let you know within a day or two. Very quick. But not all units it seems.
Interview Questions: Tell a little bit about yourself

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Southern California Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Pre-conference with the recruiter in advance to the interview. Once your paper is approved, then one on one meeting with the unit manager. About three to four questions regarding nursing experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: RN New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Southern California Hospitals (Culver City, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was efficient and descriptive. The nurse manager was excited for new grads and had a positive outlook on her nursing career. She answered all questions to the best of her ability and stated her expectations of a new grad RN.
Interview Questions: What is a time you experienced a difficult patient and how did it end?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Southern California Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: The process takes about a month. It wasn’t bad at all. You meet with the manager of the department. You’ll know that day if you get hired or not. Great place to work.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Southern California Hospitals (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Initially spoke to a recruiter, and then the department manager.  The recruiter arranged the date and time for the interview with the department manager.  The recruiter was extremely helpful, and the department manager was professional and personable.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in an employer?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Southern California Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly fast. Requiter contacted me through email and phone call and then she helped me set up an appointment. There I talked to several people (manager, the charge nurse, and the cno). I was able to get through the entire interview in one day. I was called and made an offer the next week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Southern California Hospitals (Culver City, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. After 1-2 weeks, HR manager texted me about set up my interview date. I called HR manager and she asked some questions. after that, I received text and email.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Southern California Hospitals (Culver City, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call from the recruiter about a weeks after. I was sent a link to take a personality test, and the interview was set up after the personality test. Interviewed with the nurse manager of the telemetry floor. I was interviewed by the nurse manager, it was fairly easy. Just be presentable and ready to ask the manager questions.
Interview Questions: They asked questions based on scenarios, so just use your nursing knowledge/judgment. I was also asked about lab values and who to report any changes in patient condition.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Southern California Hospitals (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had first applied online and then received and email about their job fair. Interview was with manager and director of med surg. It was no intimidating at all, they just wanted to get to know me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Why did you want to me a nurse? Why med surg?
